modules.description: This module transforms XML trees into polyglot (X)HTML5 trees using a recursive variant type that represents either text data or elements with tags and child nodes. It provides functions to output trees as (X)HTML5 markup, handling non-void elements and optionally managing document structure based on the presence of a DOCTYPE and root element. Use cases include generating valid HTML5 documents from structured XML data or selectively rendering XML fragments as polyglot markup.

This module transforms XML signal streams into polyglot (X)HTML5 output by managing document structure and serialization. It operates on `Xmlm.output` and `Xmlm.signal` types, converting signals into valid markup based on document context. Concrete use cases include streaming HTML5-compatible XML with optional DOCTYPE handling and conditional switching between XML and HTML5 output based on document structure.

This module provides values for standard (X)HTML5 document declarations and validation functions for DOCTYPE strings. It includes submodules that transform XML signal streams and trees into polyglot (X)HTML5 output, handling document structure and serialization. Use cases include streaming XML to HTML5-compatible markup and converting structured XML trees into valid HTML5 documents with proper DOCTYPE and element handling.
